拆.definition: to tear open; to tear down; to tear apart; to open

拆借.definition: to make (or take out) a short-term loan

拆字.definition: fortune telling by unpicking Chinese characters

拆家.definition: (slang) low-level drug dealer; (slang) (of a pet) to wreck the house (scattering trash, chewing on furniture etc)

拆封.definition: to open (sth that has been sealed)

拆放款.definition: funds on call; invested sum that can be cashed

拆散.definition: to break up (a marriage, family etc)

拆東牆補西牆.pinyin: chāi dōng qiáng bǔ xī qiáng
拆東牆補西牆.definition: lit. to tear down the east wall to repair the west wall (saying); fig. to rob Peter to pay Paul

拆東補西.definition: lit. pull down the east wall to repair the west (idiom); fig. temporary expedient; Rob Peter to pay Paul

拆機.definition: to dismantle a machine; to terminate a telephone service

拆洗.definition: to unpick and wash (e.g. padded garment)

拆用.definition: to tear down and reuse; to cannibalize

拆穿.definition: to expose; to unmask; to see through (a lie etc)

拆臺.definition: (theater) to dismantle the stage; (fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet; to undermine sb's plans

拆賬.definition: to work in an enterprise for a share of the profits

拆遷.definition: to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants

拆開.definition: to dismantle; to disassemble; to open up (sth sealed); to unpick

拆除.definition: to tear down; to demolish; to dismantle; to remove

拆魚羹.definition: hand-shredded fish soup, a speciality of Shunde 順德|顺德[Shun4de2]
